title: An Interview with Bill Saunders

abstract: I would have ditched, but three of my crew couldn't swim, in the Bay of Algiers. On take off, a tire blew out and took the whole undercarriage with it.
description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.
